architectural_decisions.title: Use Microservices Architecture
architectural_decisions.rationale: To ensure scalability, maintainability, and security.

architectural_decisions.title: Employ Repository Pattern
architectural_decisions.rationale: To abstract the data access layer and provide CRUD operations.

architectural_decisions.title: Utilize Dependency Injection
architectural_decisions.rationale: To manage dependencies, such as current user and payment processor, effectively.

architectural_decisions.title: Implement Custom Error Handling
architectural_decisions.rationale: To handle various error scenarios, like invalid tokens, unauthorized access, and failed payments.

architectural_decisions.title: Design Data Flow for Order Management
architectural_decisions.rationale: To enable order creation, retrieval, listing, and cancellation through specific endpoints.

architectural_decisions.title: Support Multiple Payment Providers
architectural_decisions.rationale: To enhance flexibility and cater to different payment preferences.

architectural_decisions.title: Enforce Authentication via JWT Tokens
architectural_decisions.rationale: To securely authenticate clients and authorize access to protected resources.

architectural_decisions.title: Use ORM for Database Interactions
architectural_decisions.rationale: To simplify database operations and improve code readability.

architectural_decisions.title: Send Order Confirmation Emails
architectural_decisions.rationale: To notify customers about order creation and facilitate better user experience.

components.name: orders
components.description: REST API endpoints for order management.

components.name: processor
components.description: Handles payment processing for the e-commerce API.

Create a New Order.description: Allows users to create a new order by providing order items, shipping address, and payment method.

steps.description: Send a POST request to /api/orders/create with a JSON body containing order items, shipping address, and payment method.
Verify the response for successful order creation, containing order_id, status, total, items, and created_at fields.
Handle errors as per the provided error handling guidelines.

Get Order Details.description: Retrieves the details of a specific order by its ID, accessible only to the respective user.

steps.description: Send a GET request to /api/orders/{order_id} with the order ID as a path parameter.
Verify the response for order details containing order_id, status, total, items, and created_at fields.
Handle errors as per the provided error handling guidelines.

List User Orders.description: Lists all orders for the current user, supporting pagination via limit and offset parameters.

steps.description: Send a GET request to /api/orders/ with optional query parameters limit and offset.
Verify the response for an array of order objects containing order_id, status, total, items, and created_at fields.
Handle errors as per the provided error handling guidelines.

Cancel an Order.description: Allows users to cancel a pending order. Orders that are processing or shipped cannot be cancelled.

steps.description: Send a POST request to /api/orders/{order_id}/cancel with the order ID as a path parameter.
Verify the response for a success message indicating the order has been cancelled.
Handle errors as per the provided error handling guidelines.
